    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseArmor

        public BaseArmor(net.minecraft.item.ItemArmor.ArmorMaterial material,
                 int renderIndex,
                 int armorType)
        Creates BaseArmor as ItemArmor, with additional functions and variables
        Parameters:
        material - The ArmorMaterial used for this ItemArmor
        renderIndex - Used on RenderPlayer to select the correspondent armor to be rendered on the player: 0 is cloth, 1 is chain, 2 is iron, 3 is diamond and 4 is gold.
        armorType - Stores the armor type: 0 is helmet, 1 is plate, 2 is legs and 3 is boots

      • setup

        public net.minecraft.item.Item setup(java.lang.String newname,
                                     net.minecraft.creativetab.CreativeTabs newtab,
                                     java.lang.String newuname)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns an Item with ItemArmor functions
        Parameters:
        newname - New value for BaseArmor.name
        newtab - The CreativeTabs which you want the Armor to be found under
        newuname - The value you want BaseArmor to utilize for its unlocalizedName
        Returns:
        An item with a set CreativeTabs and unlocalizedName

      • setupThis

        public void setupThis(java.lang.String newuname,
                      net.minecraft.creativetab.CreativeTabs newtab,
                      java.lang.String texture)
        Sets the BaseArmor's own variables so it can be used like an Item but with easier access to textures
        Parameters:
        newuname - The UnlocalizedName to be used.
        newtab - The CreativeTab which the BaseArmor will be listed under
        texture - The name of the .json file the texture will use. Called by the TextureHandler and ClientProxy

      • getArmorTexture

        public java.lang.String getArmorTexture(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack stack,
                                        net.minecraft.entity.Entity entity,
                                        int slot,
                                        java.lang.String type)
        Sets the Armor Texture according to this.getArmorMaterial, allowing automatic texture setting.
        Overrides:
        getArmorTexture in class net.minecraft.item.Item
        Parameters:
        stack - The ItemStack of the Armor
        entity - The Entity wearing the Armor
        slot - The slot the Armor fits in (0 = helm, 1 = chest, 2 = leggings, 3 = boots)
        type - The subtype, can be null or "overlay"
        Returns:
        A String pointing to a png file in /assets/nmm/textures/models/armor/, with a name based on the details of the Armor
